review_body: I stayed in Arlo Nomad at the end of September with my partner. It was my first time in NY and we were there to celebrate my birthday. My partner made a note about it being my birthday when booking and when we arrived they upgraded us to the most amazing room with incredible views of the Empire State Building. The whole stay was perfect and we loved the rooftop bar and the little bodega down by the front desk. Staff were all super lovely and couldn’t have been more helpful! The only thing that would have made it even better would be to have some tea / coffee facilities in the room, but not a big deal. Since our visit, my partner and I have been desperately trying to find out what the scent of the hotel is - it smells amazing! If you could tell us please do! We can’t wait to come back some day xxx

Me and my boyfriend visited NY November/December 2019, NY is a special place to us and now so is Arlo Nomad. When booking a King Bed City I asked if it was possible to have the highest room they could offer. We were greeted with incredibly attentive staff, they had taken note of our request, we very much appreciated this. As we had booked through Ebookers I had a bonus to use which upgraded our room (if there was one available) I mentioned to a staff member and they were able to offer our last night in a King Sky. We were delighted that they were even able to arrange this! During our stay at Arlo Nomad we were met with absolutely NO disappointments at all. On our first night we wanted to check out the rooftop, we were completely blown away by the view, we were lucky enough to be up there by ourselves and it was just a moment that we will never forget. The hotel also had its own smell, I made the terrible mistake of not buying the room spray (no joke when I say I’m still regretting not buying it now as I can’t get it delivered to the U.K.) honestly the best smell ever; including the amenities they leave in the bathroom to use. I have never felt so strongly about recommending a hotel more. I have told every friend and family member that it is an absolute must to stay here when visiting NY. Hoping that next time we visit we will try the SoHo location as the balconies look wonderful. I can’t imagine I will ever find a hotel that gives a better NY experience than Arlo Nomad - falling asleep/waking up to those views is something you will not forget. Thank you Arlo Nomad, sincerely you’re biggest fan :)

The place was clean and neat. Views are nice. Times are a little tough right now because of COVID so there is no restaurant or anything but they are nice enough to have complimentary coffee and tea at the front. Staff is super nice, whatever the issues may be the staff make it better. Thank you for letting us stay during these times and enjoy the views.

I have traveled quite lot, have stayed in numerous New York hotels, and around the world including in Ritz Carlton’s and Four Seasons for both business and pleasure. I don’t say this to brag, but just to make a point. Those hotels are the some of the best of the best, and Arlo has packaged many of their most special features, experiences and touches into small a intimate funky oasis of awesomeness.A pandemic is a time that tests people and shows their true colors.Shoutouts and props to Alyssa, Maggie, Ben and Cordell, and to everyone from start to finish, including guest services, the housekeeping crew and even to the other guests I ran into.Some of them were emergency responders which also says a lot about this boutique hotel. They put me in incredible room, answered every question, provided everything I needed and more, including checking me in with big smiles at 1am because of my delays, and pointed me to a great 24/7 place called Bread and Butter where I was able to get everything I needed.They really went above and beyond during this extremely difficult time, and for that I’m grateful and I will tell everybody I know what an outstanding job they do at Arlo!J. Lee.

Check in with Germin and Alyssa was smooth and informational. They were both very sweet and welcoming. Germin even upgraded us to a queen bed with a great view of the Empire State Building! Great bonus for our spontaneous night out. Deff will be coming back thanks to them!

I had stayed at this hotel for 10 days. I stayed at this hotel in order to socially distance from my family. I had made an amazing choice in doing so. The views in the room were incredible. All of the staff especially are very warm and helpful. They did everything in their ability to accommodate each and every one of my needs. Shout out to Germin for showing me all the different rooms that were available and helping me select the right one! Although the rooftop was closed due to covid, I will definitely be returning to check that out as well!

Arlo has a cool vibe with a number of amenities if you want to self explore new york. They have a great bar and rooftop and is close to everything. Also, the first time we had a comfortable bed in NYC.

Rude glares from the female staff; me and my partner received very rude tonalities from each of the front desk staff upon our interactions with them throughout our time so far. The one exception to this was the morning shift gentleman with glasses who attempted to provide access back to our room in which he was unable. Although his service was impeccable and kind, the circumstances were unfortunate and costly to the detriment of time lost due to being locked out of our room at 6AM due to a faulty door lock malfunction,. AGAIN: locked out of our room w/o access until checkout in the middle of the morning as I type this out right now. I awoke to find all this out from my partner who had attempted to gain room access with the front desk staff. This is outrageous! I have no socks on! I literally p never. (QUITRAGE) I demand a refund and an explanation. VISITING FROM SEATTLE : experience ruined

This is long overdue, but here it is more than 2 months later and what am I still thinking about? Well, Myk’s gorgeous skin and GG’s incredible makeup; that’s of course in addition to their stellar customer service (obvi). Just wanted to drop a note and say that our stay was above and beyond incredible because of GG, Myk, the aroma of the lobby, and just about everyone that Arlo offers from A-Z (and Z back to A), ayyyy! Thank you for having us (the Good Vibe Tribe) for Jaz’s 40th. In times like these, we are most grateful for the memories we had and had it not been for such epic staff like GG and Myk, the trip would not have been the same. Thank you, thank you, thank you! Sincerely, Ryan <3

Stayed at the Arlo Nomad the week before Christmas as a treat for our 10 year wedding anniversary. The staff at the hotel were absolutely fantastic, so friendly and helpful. The receptionist even gave us a little bottle of bubbly when she found out we were celebrating our wedding anniversary - a lovely gesture! Location is good, hotel is modern and clean. The room was quite small - but you’ve got to expect this in the middle of NYC. We didn’t eat at the hotel and unfortunately we didn’t get to experience the rooftop bar as it was shut, but we hope to be back again at some point! Thank you! :)

Very beautiful view!!! Amazing room!!! Very pretty and clean!!!The only thing that I don’t like it was the TV was set up too tall. Couldn’t really see. Other than that everything is good!!! Love Arlo Hotel!! Highly recommend!!!
user_name:
Jayden118
New York City, New York

review_body: I took advantage of the unfortunate opportunity that Coronavirus provided me of coming to the city in March 2020. Despite the circumstances, I opted for a nice hotel rather than an AirBnb and all I can say is: I will be back in August!! I got the King sky room on the 23rd floor. Although my view was partly a wall, I also do get the see the top of the Chrysler building in the distance. I am very pleased with everything here. The shower is super amazing as well. I usually go for the basics as far as lodging so I can have the best experiences but this changed my perspective. I love it here. It was a quick 2 days but I will definitely be back – I am glad Arlo provides such quality. I recommend coming here when staying in NYC! Thank you Arlo NoMad!

We really enjoyed our stay at Arlo NoMad. We splurged for one of the Sky View rooms and it did not disappoint. The breakfast spread is also delicious - must-try pastries and breads. We didn't get to enjoy the rooftop as it's closed in the winter, but the view is great.
user_name:
hannahrH3925VH
New York City, New York

review_body: We like and recommend the hotel. They were very cooperative since we had to check out a day early (we had to fly back earlier then expected).Except for the very formal and compact ‘welcome’, we had all great experiences with the staff we had been Reading about. Location = there is no better for these roomrates and this Level of comfort.Thank you Arko Nomad

She is definitely one of the sweetest most loyal people I have ever met in my life before. Very respectful and beyond professional. She treated my husband and I to a nice romantic dinner. By staying in the hotel numerous times, she made my husband and I reconnect for the better.❤️ Our relationship is on the right track because of Angie. We couldn’t thank her enough! She definitely deserves a higher position because she’s definitely a people person! She would literally give you her shirt off her back just to make you happy and comfortable at the Arlo stay. Thank you again Angie, you’re truly an Angel sent from God! Wishing you all the very best always and foevee. Always stay sweet and beautiful!

Great room, great view, good central location. Hotel had a coffee shop which was great and open 24hours. Will definitely stay again when I next visit New York. Staff lovely and friendly felt special on my birthday trip.

The stay at Arlo Nomad was great. Right from the checkin till the end. I stayed for 5 nights and felt at home. A special mention: Angie R at the front desk was a delight. Apart from her infectious smile, she made it her mission to make my stay a pleasure. She also bumped me to a skyview room. :)And she was also considerate to push my checkout time by a couple of hours as I was stuck in a meeting. Cheers Angie! :)And ofcourse thanks to everyone else I crossed paths. It’s definitely my go-to hotel when I visit again. Cheers, K

Not just another hotel, when you go away for business. The Team here at the Arlo NoMad make your stay an experience and not just the typical mundane stay. From Z.O. at the Bar and GiGi at Guest Services, this team makes you feel warmly welcome and they get to know you like family... and their authentic spirits have made a lasting impression on me where I would undoubtedly recommend Arlo NoMad. And for a bonus, the location is insanely short walk to work;-). Thank you, Arlo. Until the next time.

This hotel was PERFECT!!! It is very centrally located. We wanted to go as far south as Battery Park and north as Central Park and this hotel was really a great location for us. Walking distance to Bryant Park. It was super cute and hip. It had a very fun and energetic air. The ambiance was on point. Loved the bar, the yoga classes. Everyone was so friendly!! We arrived to the hotel at 9:30 am. The hotel happily accepted our luggage. To my surprise, they called me by 11am to let me know my room was ready. Who does that? Nobody lets you into a room by 11am!!!! We didn't go back to the room, however having flown the red eye, it was so comforting to know that I had the option to go back since I had only slept 2 hours on the plane. The room was typical small NY size, but it was really modern and minimalist. I loved it. It had a clean look to it, yet homey. There is a small little snack/coffee shop in the lobby. It was so cute and so perfect for any small needs. Loved the character of the hand written notes by the elevator. Would highly recommend this hotel. The hotel offered breakfast and happy hour, which was a huge perk. I was bummed that I did not take advantage of either one. But, such a nice gesture that it was available. This hotel just felt like the complete package.

After landing in New York at about 11:30pm I made my way to a hotel on the lower east side. It took me less than an hour to realize the hotel was unclean and unsafe but at midnight, I feared my options were limited. In a panic, I called the Arlo NoMad and Aziz answered. He told me that I could come right then, that there was a room available for me. I arrived to the AN about 30 minutes later. Aziz and Gigi greeted me. They were incredibly kind and understanding. After a long travel day, the value of kindness of the employees at the front desk cannot be understated. Aziz even upgraded my room! Gigi and Aziz truly made me feel so comfortable and welcome. I really can’t emphasize enough how fantastic they are. The following morning they checked in with me and got me a coffee. Seriously the best!!The actual hotel is very cute and in a great location. The room itself is clean, well appointed, safe and the shower is fantastic. The bed is super comfortable. I truly don’t have even one critique. Really wonderful experience all around.

First and foremost I was shocked by how beautiful the room was. The room was very minimal and the view of the city was amazing. I love how I can open the window to let a cool breeze in when necessary.Also, I want to give a huge shout out to Bejamin who checked us in and out. His spirit is so friendly and refreshing. He truly went out of his way to make us feel comfortable. Even gave a us a hug before we left.PROMOTE HIM!

My friends and I visited New York for my birthday and Arlo was absolutely amazing, more specifically Benjamin was absolutely amazing. He made sure we got rooms right next to each other with amazing views. He also informed us of all the things the hotel offered and sent me a special birthday gift. Check out was also super easy. Thanks so much Benjamin and Arlo NoMad for making our stay amazing :-)

The Arlo Nomad is one of the best hotels that I’ve ever been to. The hotel in general is so modern and cool, with a cafeteria inside and a restaurant, also a nice rooftop.I’ve got a room located on the 29 floor and it was stunning, extremely clean and comfortable with amazing views.The staff is awesome but Angie is the best of the best, she’s gonna make sure that you will have the best experience, taking care of every single detail and inquiry that you may have. She definitely made my trip 100 times better. The location is excellent.Breakfast was good, I would appreciate more warm meals variety. Im definitely coming back.

This hotel is just excellent. The rooms are small but when in NY, you’re not spending much time in the room. The bed is amazing, wanted to stay in bed all day. Service is great. We were able to get upgraded to a better view as well. Overall great cozy, cute hotel.

Stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate a birthday. Hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing and the Empire State building is right nearby. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and had even given us a room with the number to match my husband’s birthdate. Their recommendations for restaurants and things to do were spot on. We had a high floor room with fantastic views of the city and although it was small it had absolutely everything you needed ( right down to an umbrella)!The hotel is clean and tidy with good public areas. If I had a criticism it would be that there are often long waits for the lifts. Having said that I would definitely stay here again.

I had a 2 night stay in Arlo Hotel. It is very clean, located in a good area and has a polite staff. Prices are reasonable. Special thanks to Anderson for being helpful. Will definitely stay there again

We stayed for one night b/c we had an early morning medical procedure at a nearby hospital. Location was convenient. Room was small, but clean. Staff was courteous and helpful. Special shout out to Angie at the front desk for making accommodations.

I stayed at Arlo NoMad for the first time, for one night, in February 2020. I would definitely recommend it and definitely go back. The staff at reception was wonderful. The rooms are small but very comfortable and all of the necessities are provided, including a small refrigerator, a nicely-designed bathroom with rain shower, and good quality bed linens and towels. The hotel breakfast was buffet only, which I usually do not like. However, this buffet was presented beautifully and included things I go for, like real oatmeal and good plain yogurt. So I would recommend that also. The location is excellent.

This place rocks! Not only is it one of the best locations in midtown/downtown manhattan, the staff was great, big shoutout to Myk, the perks, which included drink tickets for the bar lounge and a breakfast ticket were a really nice touch. Although the gym is offsite, it’s worth the minute walk to get to. The room was small, but most importantly tidy and clean, Everyone on staff was just so friendly. Between the location, amazing complimentary breakfast, killer bar lounge, affordable rates, and great staff, I have a new place I can call home for future NYC trips. Highly recommend.

We had a 3 night stay here. Room was very small, but comfortable with views towards empire state building. Staff were very friendly and pleasant and the breakfast was great, fresh breads and pastries, frittata, fruit etc. The location was convenient for Broadway and times square, with good access to subway stations. Well worth a stay

The Arlo Nomad was the perfect place for a quick mother daughter getaway to celebrate her sixteenth birthday. We felt at home immediately, the staff was great, the sense of community wonderful, and the European charm just what we needed. We even loved the awesome shower heads!

Fourth time at Arlo Nomad and fourth perfect experience. Every member of the staff I spoke with has been very kind and efficient. Very special thanks to Maggie and Mikal for their attentions. I hope to come back soon !

My wife and I just returned to LA after traveling to New York City to sit shiva for a friend ours who recently lost her father. Given the nature of the trip, we weren’t expecting a special stay, but it also happened to be my birthday. When we checked into the hotel, Anderson and Caroline, the Lobby Host, took our trip to the next level. They made sure a room was ready for our early morning arrival, but they were also concerned that we wouldn’t like our view. They allowed us to drop our bags off in the first room, to rest if we needed after our red eye flight, and then, when my wife and I went to grab a bite of lunch, they moved our luggage to a new room on the 27th floor that had a view of the East River and the early morning sunrise. They also left us a sweet note of welcome and some treats. The Arlo lobby is filled with a handsome fragrance that is a breath of fresh air after a day in the city. The staff is awesome, and the room was well appointed, comfortable, and perfect for our urban needs. We will stay at the Arlo NoMad next time we are in the city, Anderson and Caroline have made sure of that. Thanks guys!!

Me and my girlfriend stayed for one night and it was the best night we've ever stayed there in decades. Since we arrived Anderson Paulino was our host at the main desk, a very nice guy, very helpful and kind. He arranged to put us on a nice rooom. The best view ever. Everything was awesome.

Where do I start..........The hotel is an amazing place to stay at, very nice location, easy access to the (Train station) Subway, there are also a few amazing please to eat. (Every Tuesday they have $1 wigs that are absolutely out of this world, and you have to wash it down with an Oi Rita) it's about 5 minutes from the hotel, Ask the front desk for details as I don't remember where it was located The room was incredible, very spacious and has an amazing view. My friend and I were upgraded after a little issue we had making our way to the hotel from the airport. Even-though it was not there problem to resolve, they went above and beyond to accommodate us considering arlo nomad was not our first choice I was surprised at how welcoming and kind they all were. Jennell, Myakal, Anderson and other staff where all very kind and helpful. Answered questions and concerns I had. They Couldn't off been any more professional.By the end of my birthday trip I was getting ready to check out and there was a little misunderstanding with the (unban fee) this is a fee of $35 everyday till you check out of the hotel. From my understanding the fee covers drinks at the bar from 4pm till 7pm and the water that is in the room etc..... As I was unhappy to say the least, I had a convocation with Cordell Nelson the director of operation he explained the fees to me, as I started to understand I also started to claimed down.Cordell was very sweet and understanding of our situation and with the miscommunication that had taken place at check in, however as he could hear from my voice I was in shock that this wasn't something that was overly specified from the beginning, he was able to take off the fees as a one of and I was very appreciative of that.I will definitely be going back to Arlo NoMad and recommend you spend you break with them, a little home away from home

Great location that was walking distance from most of the places we wanted to go. Clean, modern and quaint hotel. Stayed in a city view room with a queen bed. View was good, but not amazing. You could see the empire state building, but only if you went right up to the glass and looked over. Otherwise the view from the bed was just okay considering you are paying extra for it. Definitely tight quarters, but we knew that we booked, so that was as expected. Overall a cute hotel that I would likely stay at again. My only minor complaint was the elevator system. It felt like it always took longer than it should to get up and down and the elevator often had floors selected that nobody in the elevator was going to causing unnecessary extra time in the trip.

Made my last minute decision on choosing Arlo before I travel. Didn’t know much about the hotel until I booked it and since it’s a half business trip for me, I didn’t mean to pick a super fancy hotel. All I want is a honey, clean place to rest and close to my friend that I wanted to visit. However! This hotel surprised me and I will rate this hotel the best hotels among all the places I stayed in the USA. Of course, I didn’t stay in a lot hotels, but I personally love Arlo. Internal decorations, furniture set ups, different details, the lighting, the temperature, the service, the location. Everything is just so perfect to my standards. For the room that I stayed, is a urban view, which is located at eighth floor. Not the perfect room for viewing because I arrived super late due to the delay of the flight. But the front desk told me I can ask for upgrades! I did not upgrade my room even I really want due to my personal schedule. I will definitely go back for a better view! But if you book online and pick a city view, ask for a higher level, the view will be amazing! A lot of guests mentioned that the size of the room is pretty small. For me, I am alone plus I am Asian, I Akins of perfect the small cozy room size. It’s all personal preferences! To me, if you are traveling, it’s better to walk outside than staying at the hotel room right? The hotel room is not really necessary to be huge so you can run around, it’s more like a place to offer you a great sleep! Anyway, as I said, personal preferences, I love the size and I won’t love it more if it’s bigger size. All the products they use are available at the front desk for you to purchase. They are one of my favorite brand and the amount they provided is much more than other places who gives you a tiny bottle. I like how they have multiple functions in tv. You can watch online tv, purchase movies and even connect to your phone and chromecadt! I think everything is amazing there. I didn’t check out the gym and restaurant part so I could not leave a comment, but I do see amazing activities posted that guest can join in! Lastly, I want to mention the location again. It’s located in Korean town, and convenient to either directions. If you like night activities and want some food very late, it’s the great choice case there is a 24/7 market 2 mins walk away; a Korean restaurant right beside the hotel, a whole street of Korean food street away. Trust me, you have to try this hotel and you will love it’

We’re seasoned travelers who have stayed in lots of amazing high end hotels around the world. We loved Arlo NoMad because it has everything you need. Compact but well appointed spaces (definitely book a sky room with floor to ceiling corner window for fantastic city views), friendly, helpful, efficient staff (especially Caroline at the front desk) and a wonderful contemporary in-house middle eastern restaurant with the best, warm from the oven freshly-made laffa bread you’ll ever eat.

Eh... is that a blanket as a shower curtain lol? Idk there was no view and nothing special for Valentine’s Day they charged ridiculous but we’ve stayed in hotels who do fun things and give free stuff to their guests on Valentine’s Day it’s ok.

great hotel in a great location. for those that small rooms make them claustrophobic- it's probably not for you (although they have large windows and designed to feel larger. but for all the rest- you will enjoy it, the rooms, the common rooms (reading and working space, the lounge and the bar- all well designed in adjoined spaces

I ended up booking a last minute room at the Arlo Nomad after work brought me to NY and I was too exhausted to head back. I was met at the front desk by Angie who was literally MAGIC. She saw my frazzled state and immediately put me at ease, explained the hotel, checked me in super quickly, and shared some recommendations (and to take photos on the roof!). Angie - if you read this you made my day/night!I ran up to my room which was a street view king size room and settled in. The rooms are a bit on the smaller size (NY - it is expected) but super cozy and well designed for NY. The room was double glass windows with sheer gauze curtains, but black out shades you can drop for privacy and lighting. The bed takes up most of the room, but there was a large tv artfully right outside the bathroom, a narrow closet, and clever cabinets above the closet. The bed also had slide out side panels for side tables. As I mentioned - great design!The doors are a little thin so you can hear a lot of noise from the hallway and elevators, but it didn't seem like an overwhelmingly noisy hotel so I didn't have many issues. The hotel room also had a few free snacks in it (how kind) and has free drinks on the second floor lounge from 5:30pm-7pm. They also have a coffee shop/market on the first floor that is great, and a restaurant on the first floor. This was all totally unexpected and I feel like everything kept being a lovely special surprise. Customer service was also generally incredible. Would highly recommend for your NY needs!

Great stay at the Arlo Nomad. The front desk team Carlos, Myk and Carly A++ professionals. Couldn't ask for better service, sensitivity to time needs, and excellent customerservice. Will stay again. Need more be said.

I stayed here for 3 nights after getting married and although the room was smaller that we thought it was a great view and very good quality. The room was very clean and tidy and the daily cleaning service was amazing. If you're looking to stay here then ask for Carlos Collado. He hooked us up with some great deals and really looked after us. There is a cafe in the lobby that mates some of the best coffee in America!!

During my stay at the ARLO NOMAD, I was greeted with exceptional customer service. My trip did not feel like business when I came here due to the inextricable feeling the employees gave me, it was greatly appreciated! A name I certainly remember was Mykal, we briefly laughed about how I butchered his name a bit, but it was all good in the end. Loved the way he works !! He’s definitely sets the example for the company as a whole. Thank you to everyone !!

I had a 2+ hour drive to NY from Philly and was very tired when I arrived at Arlo NoMad to check in for the night. It was very late. Aaron at the front desk went above & beyond to make sure I got checked in quickly plus had everything I needed. It was super cold & I had a ton of heavy bags. He came out to my car himself and helped me load everything and take it into the hotel since there was no valet attendant. Aaron was pleasant, knowledgeable & made me feel welcomed. This was my first stay at Arlo NoMad. I will definitely be back due to Aaron's excellent customer service.

Wonderful place for a drink and a chat! Yummy drinks and comfortable seating. A wonderful vibe for drinks with friends! Also great service at the front desk! Especially Carlos, he's the best! Hope to come back soon!!!

Everything about this place was absolutely amazing, we stayed there for over a week and the first day we met Benjamin who was absolutely amazing and lovely until the last day. Everything was very clean and everyone was very helpful. I will totally come back to this place!

Our crew received exceptional service from staff members! Arlo Nomad has beautiful boutique style hotel with great amenities. Make sure you find GiGi, she will take great care of you from the time you arrive to the time you leave.

My husband and I stayed 2 nights and 3 days at this hotel. We arrived from SF to the hotel very early the morning of 1/31. The front desk staff, Geneva & colleague, were very welcoming, checked us in, and gave us a room immed.. It was the beginning of a very accommodating stay. (We later requested to change rooms in order to enjoy a better view, the request was performed w/o hesitation). There are many fresh choices served for breakfast (both hot and cold foods). Happy hour is a nice touch, however it would be improved if lite snacks were served w/the beverages (i.e. nuts, chips). Lastly, when we checked out Michael at the front desk recommended their on-call car service to take us to the airport, instead of taking a cab. This recc. saved us $60 in cab fees. All in all, we were very pleased w/the courteous service we received during our stay and would return again w/o hesitation. Thank you.

Visited the Arlo Nomad on a work trip that the company booked. Beyond pleased with the service and loved the decor of this hotel!! Free wine happy hour every night!! Carlos, working at the front desk was beyond helpful and kind. Definitely will return.

One of the most amazing hotels that I’ve ever stayed at. Upon arrival we had a rough & upsetting journey there & we explained this to the stuff, Mykal & Jeanell. They listened & made it their mission to make sure that we felt comfortable & at home. Gave us solutions to solve the situation we were in which was really helpful. Every morning, afternoon & evening Mykal & Jeanell along with their other colleagues Anderson, Gigi, Carlos Benjamin, Steven & Angie never fail to say Hello, Good Morning/Afternoon/Evening, Have a nice day, How’s your stay going? They even just have regular conversations with us...it was always a laugh with them. I love how everyone in their team was their own individual character & their personalities just meshed so well together. At the end of our stay we notice the urban fee was $35 a day, so we spoke to the Director of Operations, Cordell who helped us understand what it was. Arlo NoMad thank you so much much for making our stay in New York a memorable one...I’ll definitely be back here in the summer time.

I travel a lot and when I am in NYC I usually stay here if possible for a cornucopia of reasons. First of all...,when you travel as much as I do you love a place that feels like home away from home. The staff is incredible, public space is awesome to hang out and work in. It's hip but very comfortable and non-pretentious. Food onsite is awesome and its located in the NoMad/Koreantown area so you have restaurants galore...good ones...really good ones. Your hotel room key gets you into a world class fitness center a few blocks away. The location works great for me. Did I mention the staff is awesome? Yeah I did ... twice now.  Let's chat about the rooms...,Are they small? Yep...are they very well appointed with everything you need working properly? YES. If you like taking a power shower like I do you'll love it. Beds are really comfortable and room is spotless. Look if you are planning on playing tennis in your room then maybe you should look elsewhere. Views vary but usually range from fantastic to spectacular. Incl the Empire State Building. Ask the front desk for a view. They do their best to accommodate. Did I mention how awesome the staff is...yep that's the third time. Oh....and complimentary wine and snacks at the bar on the second floor amenities level for happy happy hour (I think its 5:30 to 7).  Save travels everyone.

I spent a lot of time looking at hotels before booking our trip and saw many horror stories so I was very worried about making the wrong choice but the Arlo was amazing. Yes it's pricey and yes the room is small but it's totally worth it. The room was spotless, bed comfy and not too noisey. It is near to madison square gardens and Penn station, about a 10 minute walk. There were a lot of young people in their twenties and the hotel has a 'cool' vibe, the staff were all friendly and helpful. The roof terrace looks out over Empire state which was amazing. Some reviews say that the room were too small, but in my opinion the room was functional and I'd rather have a clean, modern room, than an old, slightly bigger one (this is NYC afterall). Would definitely stay again.

I highly recommend this stylish and modern hotel in a great location. The room was small but very convenient, and the view was amazing. We stayd on the 15th floor, but if you have an option to go higher take it - you will not regret it! By the way, the restaurant downstairs is really good!

Another perfect stay at the Arlo. Kind staff, adorable hotel and great spot for a fun weekend in the city! First time at this location, but definitely coming back again! I wish I could live here forever!

Arlo Nomad rocks. Complimentary water in rooms. Complimentary wine during happy hour. Complimentary coffee in the barista bar in the lobby. Friendly staff, impressively clean rooms. Water refill station in biodegradable containers. Consumer friendly at a reasonable price & away from the commercialism of Times Square. Love Chelsea, and will stay here again. They Woke.

This hotel is a gem if you need a room for a night or two and don’t want to spend a lot. The rooms are small but they are amazingly well appointed. I am very claustrophobic and I was so happily surprised that I did not feel closed in. Rooms are small but open and big windows. Comfy bed. Everything was new and super clean. Delicious breakfast downstairs and a fun bar. Very cool vibe. Very friendly staff.

Mykal and Carlos we're great lobby hosts. Definitely recommend! I was there for a couple of hours had a drink at the bar on the second floor it was amazing! Very happy with the service, Also Hotel is very cool and hip.

Breakfast was excellent. Fresh bread & oatmeal great. Staff helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. Well located between Broadway and Fifth Ave. Access to public transportation good. Wear good walking shoes since all NY requires it irrespective of hotel location. Very safe hotel.

I was very happy to stay in Arlo. The room was very comfortable - small but cozy. The location was great and very central. The staff was so kind and friendly and the atmosphere was modern, clean and pleasant. Would absolutely recommend to stay and will definitely come back next time I will be in NY. By the way, the breakfast was also super delicious even for a vegan.

I had a great time staying at Arlo NoMad. The location is awesome, close to the subway lines, and it's in K town. Staff there was really friendly. Carlos was my lobby host. He was super helpful and really sweet. He gave me some great suggestions on the neighborhood, and answered all of my questions. He knows everything about NYC! I felt really welcome and warm during check-in. Highly recommended. Will definitely go back again. :)

I just want to start of saying my stay was nothing short of amazing! From the staff, to my room, and my beautiful view. The staff was very informative, welcoming and helpful especially Gigi! Gigi was so sweet, charismatic and hospitable. Her presence made our stay at Arlo Nomad even more enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and fam!! Thank you for everything Arlo!

Carlos Collado went above and beyond to make sure my upcoming stay at the Arlo Hotel will be amazing! He is very quick to respond and granted me all my requests. I’ve been working in hospitality for many years and it’s so refreshing to see someone take pride in their job!!! Thank you so much, Carlos!

I am a regular guest of Arlo Nomad as I am a girl who appreciates exceptional hospitality when traveling. If the good vibes aren’t right, I don’t want it! Fortunately with Arlo, the vibes are more than right! So When I visit from California there wasn't any other place I wanted to rest my head, my heels and my cocktail. Most recently I celebrated my birthday in NY and had a room block for my vibe tribe for a few days. From start to finish, I had no complaints with how each representative treated me. One rep in particular stands out the most, GiGi. When I came in late from partying, and plopped down on the lobby couch to take my shoes off from my a swollen feet kinda wild night...I didn’t even have to ask she just handed me a water and some slippers. She also went upstairs like the angel she is and came down with slippers and bathrobes for all the rest of my crew! I mean, what?! Winning! I could have died and went to Heaven right there. That’s the kind of service you’re going to get! Im still not done, there’s more kudos. When I woke up in the morning and needed coffee to come back to life, I hit the hotel bodega and simply requested a little something warm, with some flavor and life and the female barista badass whipped me up a coffee so smooth and tasty without me even having to specifically explain what might do the trick...she was already on it! Also, I appreciated Ben and Carlos and even Karly at the front desk (managers and directors) who were so helpful and accommodating from explaining invoices, suggesting good foodie spots to giving me some complimentary cards for cocktails at their bar to help me celebrate accordingly. In a nutshell, there’s no I in team so cheers to this hotel and it’s amazing team of people who helped make my birthday stay a success. I’m truly grateful for your services. Much love and I’ll so see you next year. Please have my coffee, slippers and cocktails upon check in. Though this hotel be little, it moves mountains in hotel hospitality!! Period. XoXo to you all.

Came with a group of friends for a birthday party and all I can say is wow. First of all, it smells so good in there, the staff was unforgettably helpful and nice, and the corner room view was amazing.

I travel weekly to NYCity. My first experience in Arlo Nomad, and rented a small room, with bunk beds. The room was tiny, but surprisingly beautiful, and the bathroom was huge. Definitely it took my breath away, and the staff was soooooo nice. I didn't had the time to explore the whole Hotel, but everyone and everything was inviting. Recommended 100%.

I stayed here for the weekend of 1/24/2020-1/26/2020 for my friend’s birthday. The rooms were smaller than I’m used to but the space and decor was creative and efficient. I had a city view facing an office building on one side and apartments on the other giving extreme New York vibes, and I loved it. There’s a fridge in the room and the King size bed was super comfy. I also loved the fact that the stocked water in the room was “Just Water”, which if you do your research, is a spring water with natural minerals and ph content in a plant derived carton. I haven’t seen them at too many hotels so that’s definitely a plus! Sometimes it the little things that count I also cannot forget to mention the hotel staff. From beginning to end they all were amazing and helpful. The Beautiful Gigi is apart of the overnight staff and managed to take care of us our party after a night of partying by giving us ladies complimentary slippers and bath robes. She definitely went above and beyond making sure we s as ll had everything we need. I plan on staying here again when I come back and recommend it to all other travelers as well. When you stay, be sure to take a picture on the rooftop!

From the minute we checked we were greeted with outstanding service, attention and hospitality. Everyone working at this hotel is extremely kind and helpful. Light and fun energy! Very clean and the hotel smells amazing!! Mike and Cordell were impeccable! I’m definitely staying at the Alto Nomad next time I come to New York!!

Stayed at the New Yorker Wyndham for a couple nights with the girls and decided to extend our stay. Not only was the Arlo WAY more affordable for our bruised pockets -the staff was warm, inviting and hospitable!!! After travelling all over Brooklyn the day before we had a comfortable bed and clean room to stay in. Awesome recommendations for local spots + accommodation to store our luggage for FREE. The whole place Smells amazing too special thanks to Cordell and Mike for being so helpful. Will definitely be back!

Amazing experience to stay! ! ! It always my pleasure to stay in the Arlo NoMad hotel in Manhattan! I think the Arlo NoMad Hotel is different from other hotels because of its special location, friendly staff, clean environment, and all good conditions. The breakfast is also highlighting too. I deeply love and attracts by the lemongrass smell in the hall! Also, thank you guys for upgrading my room last time and it was a peaceful night to sleep on the comfortable pillow. Again, I will stay in the Arlo NoMad whenever I come back to NYC. I already recommended the Arlo Nomad to all of my friends.

I have to give props to the fabulous GiGi for making our stay top notch! She was very friendly, down to earth, and went above and beyond to make our stay first class. She even brought us robes and slippers after a long night in those NY streets! She continued to ask if there was anything we needed and gave us that good old NY hospitality. Thank you so much! We will be back!

All the attentions were extraordinary since our arrival, quite early as our flight arrived at 4:00am. We asked Caroline days before to have a room as high as posible and she did her best to get it. We loved! The room was awesome, and the sensation is great. You have NYC in front of you. All the staff wherever helpful and the location enjoyable. We will surely come back.

I always stay at the same hotel when visiting New York but opted to try somewhere new: Arlo NoMad. The room was clean and well set out, and the hotel has a very welcoming and relaxed energy which is a stake contrast against the hustle and bustle of New York. What really sets this hotel apart is the way it's customers are treated: the customers are really placed at its core and this showed from pre-arrival to check out. Caroline (Morales) set the tone for the stay and exemplifies brilliant customer service as do other members of staff. Nothing is too much: whether this is arranging the safe keeping of my belongings, storing my pre-ordered items and ensuring these were in my room prior to my arrival, to taking steps to allow me to check in to my room early. Everything felt easy which made for a brilliant stay. I highly recommend.

I stayed at the Arlo Nomad from 1/24-1/26 2020. The hotel Lobby smells amazing. The staff is extremely helpful and professional. One employee stood out amongst the rest and her name is GIGI. She went above the call of duty to make my party’s stay special. She provided me with a complimentary bathrobe and slipper, the bathrobe is very plush and cozy. The rooms are somewhat smaller than I used to however they make great use of the space given. Bed and linens comfortable bathroom fully stocked with complimentary drinking water. Will Stay here anytime I visit New York. Thank you Gigi and Arlo staff.

I rarely if ever write reviews but having stayed at Arlo Nomad numerous times over the years I just can’t say enough how great the staff is there! They are so nice to me and my colleagues every single visit, and we are there a lot! Special shout out to Geneva who greets me every morning! Honestly the entire staff there is amazing! Benjamin, Che, Steven, Jeanelle, Paola, Aziz.....they are all terrific. Service great, neighborhood awesome, rooms clean and comfortable!

I had a great time here. I came here recently with my friends and the rooms were comfortable along with the service. The staff were very respectful and receptive and I appreciate them. Mykal and the rest of the team really did their thing, will definitely be coming back.

Note: this review is for pre-stay customer service.I have to share the excellent customer service I received at Arlo NoMad. Steven Lantigua, was very help with correcting a reservation I had made online through my booking agent. Steven was polite, patient and friendly. If this is any indication of what my boss will experience next week during his stay...he will be well taken care of. Which is all I can ask for.

I almost didn't even want to review because this hotel is one of the best kept secrets in New York City. I've been coming here for a few years now and it's more than just a hotel. It really is an experience. From the artsy, boutique feel, to the incredible staff service and affordable prices - it's A+. The lobby host Carlos C went above and beyond checking us in, making sure our bags were taken care of, and even showed us around the hotel's common areas and amenities. I was really impressed with his level of customer service and he really made us feel welcomed and relaxed after a long day of travel. The room's views are stunning, and it's really all you need (and more). It also seems like they're constantly working on making the amenities even better as well, with a cool bar area, library, and lounge. During the warm weather, their rooftop is impeccable (another secret spot). 5 stars for Arlo Nomad and staff. Many Thanks to Carlos! Will definitely be back again soon.

This is a superb hotel to visit! It offers plenty of space to enjoy time with family or friends. I highly recommend staying here if you are new to the country or to the state of New York. Most importantly, the lobby hostess Paola Munoz made me feel the most at home. Paola went out of her way to make sure I could see the best amenities that the hotel offers. It was a spectacular experience due to the hospitality that was displayed toward me. The tea was fantastic, as was the artwork and love letters on the elevator walls. This is the best hotel I’ve seen in a very long time!!!

Stayed for 4 nights in Dec for a work trip.. funky "boutique" hotel in a really central local. Whilst I did have an issue with a bathroom fan which couldn't be switched off, the staff, and in particular Paola Muniz - Lobby Host, did absolutely everything to accommodate me including moving me from the 4th to the 26th floor into a much higher standard room with unbelievable City views. Hotel was clean, modern, smelled amazing! and had a lively vibe around the lobby area. For a short city break I would definitely recommend the hotel.

We were lucky enough to celebrate our anniversary this past weekend at the Arlo Nomad. The manager, Maggie and her staff could not have been more hospitable and helpful in making our stay enjoyable and memorable. Special recognition to Steven and Carly. The hotel has a great vibe. The common spaces have an awesome design. The rooms are small but functional.Thank you again Arlo Nomad for a great stay.

Have stayed here twice in the last few months. Staff is great and helps you with whatever you need. Rooms are small, but well designed and have everything you need. Location in Midtown is great and you can walk easily to many tourist destinations and restaurants. Hotel has a great coffee bar and restaurant (Lamalo). Also, wine happy hour is a great benefit. All and all, this is a great place to stay in Midtown and worth the money.
user_name:
BrianB202WDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My Birthday celebration was made even more special by Carly and Caroline at the front desk who took extra special care of me ! Great location wonderful views - happy hour and more ! Highly recommend this wonderful urban paradise

The Arlo Nomad is clean, efficient, the staff is great and the lobby smells wonderful! My stayed 4 nights and the location made it convenient for me to get to all of my meetings and appointments. I look forward to returning to the Arlo Nomad!

Just want to say that the folks at the front desk are so nice and welcoming. I didn’t really have a problem for them to solve or anything like that, but I felt confident that they would have my back if necessary. Anyway, kudos to your polite and friendly staff. I enjoyed another nice stay. Arlo NoMADl is well located vis a vis subways and such to various districts throughout the city. IMO.

I honestly can't say enough nice things about this hotel. It's affordable, but still posh. The staff members are incredibly kind and accommodating. The room was small, but just perfect for our weekend trip... with amazing views. We loved the rooftop and all of the little "extras" provided (drinks, water, snacks, note in the room). I will be recommending this hotel to everyone planning a trip to NYC!

I had such a lovely stay with the team at Arlo. The hotel facilities were great, the evening drinks are a lovely touch and the rooftop views are beautiful. However, it’s the team who make this place. Super helpful and friendly, always remembering you and how best to make your day better. Shout out to Aaron R, one of the hosts. He was awesome.

I've stayed here a few times now for work and the amenities are great. There's a common work space, a free happy hour type event on weekdays and plenty of food options for quick grab and go or relaxing seated meals. The rooms are functional and comfortable with no frills, but that's kind of perfect. I have not visited while the roof bar was open, but look forward to checking it out on a future stay.

Came here for a week for my girlfriends birthday and I couldn’t be more satisfied. Experienced a slight inconvenience when I checked in but the staff was truly concerned about how they could turn it around. I could feel the concern and boy did my stay take a huge turn for the best! Steven was my go to staff member all trip but the entire staff was very attentive throughout all hours of the day. The rooms were small but I found it perfectly designed to cater to the concept. See you guys next year! ✈️

European style, stylish and functional, quiet hotel rooms with comfortable beds, comforters and pillows. Windows that open! Delicious food at Lamalo and cafe on ground floor. Staff are friendly, efficient and responsive. Great place to stay while attending meetings at UN.

I visited last week and wow what a hotel. I love the location, so conveniently put near ALL THIS SHOPPING. I left broke. Thank you Mykal for for telling us about Sauce. So yummy! Try the upside down pizza

I enjoyed this hotel vey much. it was very clean, nicely decorated and felt very cozy. I loved the room although a bit small yes, but very clean and cozy also. I loved the soap and body wash they provided for guests. I usually take my own and used theirs instead. The views from the room were everything. Location is SUPER convenient. Both the night and day staff were VERY friendly and helpful at anything you needed. I would definitely stay again.

Spent Christmas in New York with 2 teenage sons. Their bunk room was excellent with view of Empire State building. They loved the tv at the end of each bed! The room wife and I had was great - clean and comfortable with great shower. Yes, our room was not large but was absolutely fine as we only tend to sleep in the hotel and not lounge in the room during the day. Arlo NoMad is a great location in Korea Town. Easy walk to most of the main sites in Midtown, and to the hop on/off bus routes. Found it to be an ideal location for our visit. Staff are excellent and could not be more helpful. They arranged the airport transfer for us prior to our visit on request - nothing was too much trouble. We only had breakfast in the hotel one morning - it was really good but expensive. Our intention had always be to eat out in Midtown prior to going off for the day, and this worked out well. Rooms were quiet and had no problem sleeping - bed was very comfortable. Will definitely go back and stay at the Arlo NoMad again when visiting New York.

I absolutely love the location of the hotel. It’s only one block away from Korea town. Check in was very smooth and I couldn’t have been happier dealing with Angie from the concierge team. She is a gem and gave me wonderful suggestions. The only downside about this great establishment is the homeless shelter across the street. I would definitely recommend to my colleagues and friends.
user_name:
sgtpepperx4
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed at Arlo NoMad over Christmas and didn’t regret it one bit. Let’s talk location first. It’s situated smack in the middle of midtown hence it’s extremely convenient to anything and anywhere. Lots of KBBQ around considering too. It’s also walking distance to Herald Square which isn’t far from Times Square and Bryant Park. Not forgetting Arlo is along 5th Ave. The staff were amazing. Extremely friendly and helpful. Two incidents particularly stood out for me. The first was when I decided not to get my room made for almost two days and had the DND sign on. The front desk emailed me to check up on me which I feel was a really nice touch and a show of concern from them. The other incident was when I came down with fever and had asked the front desk if they could help contact and see if I can get my Broadway tickets rescheduled. Though it was unsuccessful, I really appreciated the help from front desk. As I was travelling alone, the Queen Urban room was perfect for me. It didn’t feel cramped at all, instead it was cosy. Everything was great though sometimes the heater can get a little noisy. I was situated at level 5 so I didn’t have any issue with the lifts like other reviewers did. This is due to me using the 1st lift that only served up to level 8. I didn’t really used the facilities there though I briefly checked out the rooftop bar during Xmas. Beautiful sunset to take in with a view of the Empire State Building. I feel the price is on the steep side but having scouted around for hotels in NYC, I would say the rates are identical around and Arlo looked the best. I will definitely be staying with Arlo again (maybe in SoHo next time round) when I come back to NYC. Brilliant all round!

I have stayed in NYC many times and used to live here. I have to say this is I think the smallest hotel room I have ever seen, even for an apartment. If you are one person it’s fine, but for two, it’s very cramped. Location is pretty decent, but I don’t love Nomad. The elevators are a bit slow, but the staff is super welcoming, helpful and accommodating, they get a true 5 star.

This is my second stay at ArloNomad , and for the money It’s a great buy !! The staff is friendly and accommodating, and there’s two great rooms upstairs to chill or do work . The rooms are small, and this time we had a bunk bed room, each with its own tv at the end . The only thing I didn’t like was the bathroom had a glass door, which wasn’t totally see through , but could see the shadows and it was awkward to share with a friend. They also offered complimentary wine at 5:30 pm. This place is near Madison Square Garden , and we walked to Times Square , took many 20 minutes . They are great about storing your bags until you leave. Plan to return .

I liked a lot the breakfast, the decoration, the rooms (small but good quality), the service in the reception, live music, the size of the hotel and the place. Very good hotel to stay with my daughter. I recomend this hotel.

Gorgeous, stunning, perfect, comfortable, easy. I loved this holiday because of this hotel. I felt like I was truly absorbing all of NYC every second because the view is so iconic from this hotel. Don’t feel guilty eating delicious snacks and pizza in bed! Also, the shower was wonderful. Every bit of space is well designed and economized. Shocked and elated to find just the cutest fridge!!!!Great location!

Great hotel, rooms on the small side but to be fair we where only in the room to sleep. Was fine for two people. Shower was great also. Free wine or cava for a couple of hours in the evening. We only stopped once as we where out the rest of the time. Staff so helpful. From our room we could see the Empire State Building. Roof top bar closed for winter but you could still go up and we got some great photos. Very close to Macy’s Empire State. Great breakfast place round the corner from the hotel. Would stay here again.

Great location in NYC. Small rooms but that is reflected in the price. Common areas are plentiful and comfortable. Staff is friendly and responsive. A very good option for a reasonable price in NYC. I would return to this hotel.

I stopped by Arlo with my parents who were visiting me for Christmas. I’ve been there a couple of times, had fantastic experience in the restaurant, bar and was excited to show them the amazing rooftop that this hotel has. Unfortunately the rooftop was closed for the season, but we were very lucky to meet Carlos (Lobby Host) who was extremely nice. We felt very important and cared for. He took us to the rooftop, so my parents could check out the mind blowing view of Empire State Building and experience the glass floor (wow)! He also treated us complementary drinks at the bar later. This is the perfect example of hospitality! We left feeling very happy! I’m coming back to get some more dining experience there. And next time I need to rent a room in a hotel, Arlo NoMad is number one on my list. Thank you, Carlos !
user_name:
volhaparkhats
New York City, New York

review_body: My father and I just returned from a 3 Night trip to NYC January 2nd-January 5th 2020. We stayed at this hotel which is in a great location in midtown Manhattan as it is close to 5th avenue , Penn station the subway, CVS and Bread and Butter. We were taken care of very well during our stay at the Arlo NoMad by Paola Munoz the lobby host. Right when we got there she made our stay very easy and enjoyable. She was always willing to help us in anyway. She helped us get an upgrade with one room on the 29th floor and another room facing the Empire State building! She was always trying her best to make our stay really enjoyable and comfortable by going out of the way and helping us if we had any problems. She even went to the snack counter so I could purchase a pop! and did not have to wait for the snack person to come back! She is wonderful with a bright future in the hotel industry. The Arlo NoMad is lucky to have an employee like her! We would definitely come back again and stay at the Arlo NoMad.One con was that the first night a lady was yelling so loud on my floor the 21st from 8pm-3am! It was hard for myself to sleep that night and for people on the 22nd floor as well. Ear plugs did not work at all. But other than that great hotel!

I had a beautiful stay at the Arlo NoMad. The view from my hotel room was spectacular. My boyfriend and I only stayed here for one night. We decided to go to a few bars and headed back to the hotel upon our return Gigi (the front desk) gave us free pizza.

Me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights from 29th Dec 2019. There was a little delay in check in as our room wasn't ready yet (we arrived at dead on 3pm) and we were provided with a free coffee while we waited, which we really appreciated and the delay was only around 20 minutes. Our room was what we had booked, it had 2 huge windows with a city view. We were on the 18th floor, I can only imagine what the views must be like from the higher floors. Yes the rooms are not very spacious but it was plenty big enough for us. The bed was very comfy and the room and bathroom were very clean. The room was cleaned daily and we even got fresh bedding. All staff we spoke to were friendly and helpful. It was in a great location for getting around Manhatten and the empire state building is just around the corner. We will definitely stay here again when we return to NYC.

I enjoyed my stay here at the Arlo Nomad. I was here for 4 nights in January 2020. The location was convenient and pretty much walkable to almost all the places I came here to go to-MOMA, etc. The hotel is a boutique hotel and has a restaurant to eat at and a library and bar on the second floor which are both nice. I did not check out the rooftop bar as it was closed. There is also a 24/7 bodega you can get food and drink if you need to as well. I did not realize the Arlo hotels were known for their smaller rooms. As I am used to staying in rooms a little larger I asked front desk person Caroline if there was another room that I could possibly change to. She was very polite and professional and the next day offered me another room that was more suitable to what I was used to. The only downside to this hotel is the lack of a gym, their resort fees you need to pay when you get here and the fact you can not order food at the bar which is ridiculous considering there is a restaurant on the bottom floor and when you are alone it is easier to sit at a bar and eat.

I had a wonderful stay at the Arlo NoMad ! The hospitality that everyone brought me was definitely something to remember. A special thanks goes to Mykal, such wonderful employee, from leadership to how he coordinated the process. This hotel is definitely going to be one of my regulars when I come to NY. I also recommend the Jongro BBQ for some great food.

Modern, youthful hotel in a Perfect place in the city.Clean and modern room. The hotel has a beautiful view rooftop, where you can see the Empire State Building. We would like to come back and feel of the New York feeling.

I haven't actually stayed here, but I wanted to purchase a gift card for an employee. When I contacted the hotel, they said that they didn't officially do gift cards but that they would make something up personally for me. I worked with their executive administrator and finance people to make it happen. I was doing this all the week of and after Christmas, when most people aren't working. My contact even told me she wasn't in the office but she was in constant contact with me answering questions, and even dealing with the fact that even after we went through everything to get gift card - it was to the wrong Arlo location. I panicked, but it was no problem at all and everything was fixed. Great group of corporate people!

This is the smallest hotel "room" I've ever stayed at in NYC. There is no privacy in the bathroom, it's an open concept. I felt like I was staying in a hostel, not a 4-star hotel. Luggage is left at the front entrance, not in a secured location. The elevators take forever. And the decor looks like someone slapped up some used manilla envelopes on the walls.

Hands down BEST hotel in NYC and I will definitely be returning !! Upon arriving to the hotel I was greeted by the kindest gentleman (Myk) who was able to direct me to Valet Parking and set me up with my reservation. The room wasn’t available yet but they made sure to take care of my bags for me and contact me once my room was ready. I later spoke to a wonderful young woman (Angie) who informed me she would be able to upgrade my room for me for a great price for my last two nights of my stay. (Which I was originally looking to book so it made our day so much better) Her attitude was absolutely amazing and so welcoming. Later that night I came down to the lobby to grab some stuff and was helped by another kind gentleman (Andy) who was able to point me in the right direction and just had such a great attitude as well. These three made our stay just absolutely PERFECT in every way. They are such a great face for Arlo Nomad and I hope you guys never lose them ! They helped us in more ways then I could have asked and forever blessed. A perfect way to ring in the new year !!

My stay was nothing less than spectacular. From check-in to check-out everything was perfect. I do want to applaud one gentleman Mykal (I wrote his name down just to make sure I didn't forget lol) for his knowledge and outstanding service! He knows the place like the back of his hand and he's such a sweet young man! Good service is hard to come by in this city but you'll get it at Arlo!

Just returned yesterday from New York . This hotel has everything you could need . It is slap bang in the middle of everything . Empire State is a street away . Rooms are small but immaculate , everything you need is there. The hotel smells amazing when you walk in ... like men’s aftershave . The toiletries are equally amazing . Hairdryer works a treat . The bed is so comfy , lovely white linen ... just what you need after a long day walking round the city . The full length window in the room is wow , you could just sit and watch the world go by. Roof top Terrance was amazing at night ... the view is spectacular . Staff were all lovely , polite and very attentive . Definite recommend to anyone going to stay in New York .

I stayed 6 nights at Arlo NoMad and it didn’t disappoint. I emailed a manger beforehand to ask if I could be placed in a room at the highest floor possible. When I checked in, they said they allocated me a room on the 29th floor (last floor with bedrooms). I was so pleased as I faced the Empire. It was a truly spectacular view. Thank you Maggie! I will list the pros and cons:Pros-Absolutely breathtaking view from my room.-Fabulous location - Penn Station is walking distance to get train to EWR (super easy and much cheaper than cab if you don’t have a lot of luggage).-The room was beautifully and very cleverly designed. There was plenty of storage and I loved the in-built hooks for my pajamas.- Cosy bed with crisp linen. I had the best sleep every night.- Citibike cycle passes - included in Urban Fee and saved me from using the subway. I highly recommend downloading the Citibike app and and explore NYC on bike. It’s safe and so much fun! - Housekeeping staff - always so friendly and polite whenever I saw them. Special shout out to Meryem. My room was immaculately clean daily. - The lounges on the 2nd floor were so relaxing. - Great water pressure despite being on the 29th floor. - There were some lovely snack samples in the room. I really enjoyed these. -lovely toiletries and the steamer and hairdryer were very useful.- If you are used to room service, this isn’t the place for you. It’s a lovely but functional hotel. - Althought the roof lounge is not open, do go up there to experience the view and the glass platform. I can’t imagine a better Empire SB view. Go there in the morning and night. - if you get lost, just look for the Empire and head in that direction. - would definitely return as a solo traveller.- really enjoyed reading the memory board outside the lift. Haven’t seen this in any other hotel. Reading all the happy sentiments reinforced what an amazing city NYC is.Cons- The rooms are cleverly designed but I’m not sure there would be enough space for large suitcases. It was fine for my small trolley bag. However, Arlo are very honest about the room size. - I told Reception staff I didn’t drink alcohol and they said non-alcoholic beverages would be available during happy hour (included in Urban Fee). The bar man made me a lovely mocktail, however, wasn’t pleased about it. I think you need to make non-alcoholic options available as there are teetotalers or those who drink out of choice. It seems unfair to exclude these people given they pay the same urban fee as those who can have endless wine.-All Urban Fee benefits are not widely publicized. I read what this included before I arrived and had to ask for gym and bike passes. These should be listed as a matter of course. I saw the list in the lift but it wasn’t a full list.- The water bottles were really lovely and I used my bottles daily. As someone who consumes copious amounts of mineral water, it saved me a lot of money and waste. However, I think more should be made available throughout the stay and not just on the day of arrival. - The Urban Fee didn’t represent good value. I paid $210 for 6 days. - More steps could be taken to be more sustainable. For example, individual fruit at the Bodega doesn’t need to be wrapped in plastic.

After booking this Hotel nearly a year ago based on the positive reviews and the central location, I honestly don't think words and pictures do it justice.The Staff on the door and Reception were friendly and welcoming, always wishing us a good day. The cleaners left our room spotless every day we returned with everything we'd used replenished. The room, although small, wasn't as small as I was expecting! It had everything - a safe, a hairdryer, a big comfy bed, a huge TV with a Chromecast, which was brilliant as we could watch Netflix!You won't be disappointed with the Skyline Room, I wasn't anticipating the room's view to be quite as special as it was. Though if you don't have a view of the Empire State Building from your room, the rooftop bar (although closed for winter) allows you to explore and take incredible photos.The Hotel has a restaurant, take out coffee facilities in the lobby and a luggage hold facility.It has a ridiculously central location, with Times Square a 10 minute walk away.Honestly can't recommend this Hotel enough!

We stayed late December. Small, clean rooms. Basically a bathroom and a bed but a good value for Manhattan. We didn't spend much time there as we were shopping and site seeing. Convenient to the trains and near enough to midtown. Staff were friendly and helpful. We'd stay there again. TV signal as intermittent. Internet adequate.

We checked into Arlo Nomad on 19th December for a week. It was everything we wanted it to be. It was central to everywhere we wanted to go. The staff were friendly, all day, EVERYDAY! The barman serving free drinks to hotel guests in the Arlo Barlo from 17:30-19:00 everyday was the kindest and happiest guy! We got to watch Christmas movies like White Christmas, Home Alone and The Grinch in the lounge on a projector with our free wines (definitely more than one glass) The bedroom had a glass wall displaying the city’s buildings. Was a room with a view for sure. The rooftop was open for an even better view so we got a 360 view of the city from up high, and that included a close up of the Empire State Building where the lights would change colour every evening depending on the occasion. Arlo was a short walk to Browns Bagels which are highly recommended! The smell of the hotel entrance was beautiful, it was like stepping into a spa resort! We made some friends whilst visiting the Arlo Nomad, and I would recommend this hotel to all friends and family planning on visiting NYC! I could not flaw this hotel for accessibility, location, staff, amenities and interior design! 10/10 visit. I loved every bit of it.

The Arlo NoMad was AMAZING! We would stay again and recommend it to everyone. Yes, the room was small (expected in NYC), but clean, modern, and had everything you needed...including a mini fridge. We had a gorgeous view of the Empire State Building! The hotel breakfast was so good, the staff was over the top friendly, and the aromatic smells all through the hotel were such a treat after being in the stinky city all day. We enjoyed a move and free drinks in the second story lounge our last night and wished we would have done it more, such a great perk provided by the hotel. And don’t forget to visit the roof top...amazing city views, Empire State Building right there and a very cool New York mural on the building. From check in to check out, our stay was perfect. They even kept our bags for us so we could explore the city before checking in and after check out on our last day! Perfect location to the subway, but we walked everywhere and it seemed to only be a mile or 2 from all major things you would want to see. I can’t say enough good things about the staff and the service!!! Not sure I would stay there with my kids but it was absolutely the perfect place for my husband and I!

We had a very nice stay at Arlo nomad. We booked in a Queen room urban. Unlike the pictures for this room we did not receive a massive floor to ceiling window but a very small pokey window. This was a bit disappointing but we didn’t bother to complain or ask to be moved as we know rooms are not always as advertised. However I think it’s important to note for other guests to avoid disappointment when booking. The lack of the big window did make the room feel smaller. But they are very well designed. The location is very good and easy walking distance to and from Times Square and other attractions. The stay are very very good and the rooms are clean and stylish. We enjoyed the cafe downstairs and the roof top up stairs. Overall we enjoyed the hotel and would stay again.

We loved our stay at the Arlo NoMad. Our roomwas comfortable and although it was small, the huge windows made me feel like I was floating above the bustle of the city. The staff were warm and attentive. And the wine happy hour was a big plus. Would stay again.

Really liked the hotel it was in a great location, right by empire state building we could actually see that from our room view which was amazing! The lifts were quick and easy to use. Hotel actually upgraded us which was really good of them.I do have 1 big negative and this is just down to lack of common sense from the staff member who checked us in. I messaged the hotel a few weeks before our stay stating that I was hoping to make my girlfriend my fiancee by the end of the trip. When we got there the guy on reception said oh your getting married! I was so annoyed and this could have ruined the surprise (luckily it did not and she did say yes 2 nights later). Just think a lot of couples go to New York for this and he should have known better!Overall though loved our stay and was a special one to remember!

I have stayed at the Arlo 6 or 7 times for work, and each time the staff have been extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms are small but neat and clean and well stocked; the views are fabulous. Great pastries available in the morning!

The service by the staff make this place special. I've been taken care of by the hostess incredibly well. If you need advice on food, entertainment, best coffee or gym directions just ask. Thank you Paula!

This hotel offers micro rooms .. I call them way too small rooms. After bumping my head twice in the bathroom and the bedroom I came to the conclusion that I am simply not a great fit for this place. Most staff is super friendly, the common space is trendy and the location is very good.

The staff at the Arlo really make this hotel. From check in to check out they all exceeded my expectations. Special mention to Angie who checked us in. She greeted us with a smile and she seemed genuinely pleased to welcome us to the hotel. Will definitely return to the Arlo on my next visit to New York.

Clean, comfortable, a great view. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. All the staff that I came into contact with were very pleasant. So quiet and very restful. I cannot say enough good about the Arlo Nomad. Check it out, you won't be dissappointed.

Caroline at the front desk is the best! She made sure everything went smoothly with our stay and was extremely helpful! Everything about our stay was great 10/10! I would definitely come back and stay here again

I can’t give this place 5 stars because I didn’t love it, but really can’t fault it. It does everything that it should do in terms of providing better priced, centrally situated accommodation in NYC. Most of the rooms are super compact (reflected in the price), but they are new, clean and have everything you need to rest your head. The location was good, a couple of really great and notable Korean places to eat right outside the door. We were a little disappointed that more wasn’t made of the the rooftop bar which wasn’t open, given that it’s such a great spot with a great view, although that may have been something to do with it being November. The whole vibe of the hotel is very cool, friendly and efficient and I even spotted it recently as a filming location in one of the modern love episodes, what an accolade! All in all a great & reasonable NYC hotel.

An excellent hotel with amazing views of the city, within walking distance of everything necessary. All of the staff were extremely friendly and made my stay great.Only caveat - if the rooftop bar is a selling point, make sure you don't go during the winter period as it's closed for safety reasons when the weather is too low.Other than that i have nothing negative to say at all!

This is a functional hotel in a central (but bit dirty) location. It is relatively clean and beds for being bunk beds comfortable. However, do not expect luxury of the 4 star hotel. 1) it has bunk beds 2) the tv is not working well (see photos) 3) it has water damage 4) towels could be much better, 5) bathroom is unusual to say the least (see pictures) 6) there is a day fee for not sure what luxury and more i wish that hotels were more honest about what they offer.

Our stay with your hotel was fantastic, staff extremely helpful and couldn't do enough for us, although they have a coffee shop in reception it would be quite nice if there was Tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. Would definitely recommend to other's and would 100% stay again.

I started out grumpy at the Arlo Nomad - the cause being their “urban fee”. Booking late I was already paying top dollar for the room - over $400 for a teeny tiny room so the additional $35 seemed to be adding insult to injury.However over the course of my stay my mood thawed. Firstly the Wi-Fi included in the urban fee is properly fast - almost 100mbs download speed. Second, although the room was tiny, the bed was comfy and the shower pressure good.Most of all though the staff were all lovely. Nothing was too much trouble. I even managed to borrow one of their bikes for a couple of hours.Generally I dislike resort fees as they are a tax on the single traveller. That’s still the case at the Arlo but at least their inclusions are worth having. I would come back. I’d just try and book earlier next time!

We loved Arlo and all the people there! The hotel is located in midtown Manhattan. And we did not often had to use the subway. Our Room was on the 19th Floor and we had an awesome view on the Empire State Building The Hotel was very clean and there is a hair dryer and a hand iron in the room.It was an awesome trip!
